title: Number of cats in the U.S. 2000 to 2017
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of cats in millions, with a total of 9 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2004 to 2000.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2017 to 2015.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2015 to 2013.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2013 to 2011.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2011 to 2008.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2008 to 2006.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2006 to 2004.
